member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.Common.DateTimeSerializer.RepairXsdTimeSeparator(System.String)
member.summary: Repairs an out-of-spec XML date/time string which incorrectly uses a space instead of a 'T' to separate the date from the time. These string are occasionally generated by SQLite and can cause errors in OrmLite when reading these columns from the DB.
member.param: The XML date/time string to repair
member.returns: The repaired string. If no repairs were made, the original string is returned.

member.summary: Parses a date time string with a manual set of rules

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sEmitCamelCaseNames
member.summary: if the is configured to take advantage of specification, to support user-friendly serialized formats, ie emitting camelCasing for JSON and parsing member names and enum values in a case-insensitive manner.

member.summary: if the is configured to support web-friendly serialized formats, ie emitting lowercase_underscore_casing for JSON

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.propertyConvention
member.summary: Define how property names are mapped during deserialization

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sThrowOnDeserializationError
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the framework should throw serialization exceptions or continue regardless of deserialization errors. If the framework will throw; otherwise, it will parse as many fields as possible. The default is .

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sAlwaysUseUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the framework should always convert to UTC format instead of local time.

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sAssumeUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the framework should always assume is in UTC format if Kind is Unspecified.

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sAppendUtcOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets whether we should append the Utc offset when we serialize Utc dates. Defaults to no. Only supported for when the JsConfig.DateHandler == JsonDateHandler.TimestampOffset

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sEscapeUnicode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if unicode symbols should be serialized as "\uXXXX".

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sIncludePublicFields
member.summary: If set to true, Interface types will be prefered over concrete types when serializing.

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sMaxDepth
member.summary: Sets the maximum depth to avoid circular dependencies

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.sModelFactory
member.summary: Set this to enable your own type construction provider. This is helpful for integration with IoC containers where you need to call the container constructor. Return null if you don't know how to construct the type and the parameterless constructor will be used.

member.name: P:NServiceKit.Text.JsConfig.PreferInterfaces
member.summary: If set to true, Interface types will be prefered over concrete types when serializing.

member.name: T:NServiceKit.Text.Marc.Link`2
member.summary:
Pretty Thread-Safe cache class from: http://code.google.com/p/dapper-dot-net/source/browse/Dapper/SqlMapper.cs
This is a micro-cache; suitable when the number of terms is controllable (a few hundred, for example), and strictly append-only; you cannot change existing values. All key matches are on **REFERENCE** equality. The type is fully thread-safe.

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.DefaultBufferSize
member.summary: @jonskeet: Collection of utility methods which operate on streams. r285, February 26th 2009: http://www.yoda.arachsys.com/csharp/miscutil/

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadFully(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads the given stream up to the end, returning the data as a byte array.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadFully(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given stream up to the end, returning the data as a byte array, using the given buffer size.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadFully(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads the given stream up to the end, returning the data as a byte array, using the given buffer for transferring data. Note that the current contents of the buffer is ignored, so the buffer needn't be cleared beforehand.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.CopyTo(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Copies all the data from one stream into another.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.CopyTo(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies all the data from one stream into another, using a buffer of the given size.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.CopyTo(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Copies all the data from one stream into another, using the given buffer for transferring data. Note that the current contents of the buffer is ignored, so the buffer needn't be cleared beforehand.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadExactly(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads exactly the given number of bytes from the specified stream. If the end of the stream is reached before the specified amount of data is read, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadExactly(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads into a buffer, filling it completely.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadExactly(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads exactly the given number of bytes from the specified stream, into the given buffer, starting at position 0 of the array.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadExactly(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads exactly the given number of bytes from the specified stream, into the given buffer, starting at position 0 of the array.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StreamExtensions.ReadExactlyFast(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as ReadExactly, but without the argument checks.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StringExtensions.BaseConvert(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts from base: 0 - 62

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.StringExtensions.FastToUtf8Bytes(System.String)
member.summary: Skip the encoding process for 'safe strings'

member.name: T:NServiceKit.Text.Support.DoubleConverter
member.summary:
A class to allow the conversion of doubles to string representations of their exact decimal values. The implementation aims for readability over efficiency.
Courtesy of @JonSkeet http://www.yoda.arachsys.com/csharp/DoubleConverter.cs

member.name: F:NServiceKit.Text.Support.DoubleConverter.ArbitraryDecimal.decimalPoint
member.summary: How many digits are *after* the decimal point

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.Support.DoubleConverter.ArbitraryDecimal.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs an arbitrary decimal expansion from the given long. The long must not be negative.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.Support.DoubleConverter.ArbitraryDecimal.MultiplyBy(System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplies the current expansion by the given amount, which should only be 2 or 5.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.Support.DoubleConverter.ArbitraryDecimal.Shift(System.Int32)
member.summary: Shifts the decimal point; a negative value makes the decimal expansion bigger (as fewer digits come after the decimal place) and a positive value makes the decimal expansion smaller.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.Support.DoubleConverter.ArbitraryDecimal.Normalize
member.summary: Removes leading/trailing zeroes from the expansion.

member.name: M:NServiceKit.Text.Support.DoubleConverter.ArbitraryDecimal.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value to a proper decimal string representation.
